challengeName: !!Four Days!! SunShot - Windowstreet Financial Mean.io Management Portal
detailedRequirements:
Project Overview

The endowment portal is an informational endowment specific portal where endowment managers can login to see how their investment is performing. It gives an overview of the money invested and carbon impact of those investments.

Challenge Overview

In this challenge, you are provided with an existing web application built using MEAN stack and we will refine it and implement missing functionality.

Challenge Requirements

You will use MEAN technology stack :

  • Express.JS 4.0

  • MongoDB (latest stable version)

  • AngularJS

  • Node.JS (latest stable version)

  • Nginx (as reverse proxy)

Existing Application

  • It is provided in challenge forums, it has README file for deployment instructions.

  • This web application is not complete, you are fixing it and adding more functionality to it in this challenge.

  • You are responsible on fixing any bug in the code.

Model Definition

  • The models are presented in this ERD diagram

  • You can add more models as needed, and suggest improvements to the existing Models and ERD.

  • Roles : in this portal only Endowment and Admins can login. Installer and Borrower may be roles down the road. Your solution is preferred to be flexible to add more roles in future.

 

Pages Requirements

Navigation

Fix existing admin pages to have a consistent layout :

  • A header with logo placeholder at the left side. Use logo in endowment lang page.

  • For logged in users it should show “Welcome {useremail} | Logout” in the right side.

Login Page

  • The page will display login form.

  • Option to reset password (forgot password?)

  • User cannot register in the portal, can only be added by admins.

  • If logged in user’s role is endowment, redirect user to Portal Landing Page, otherwise (admin), redirect user to Admin portal landing page.

  • Note about current login page :

    • The page layout should be updated to follow navigation notes.

    • The login form should be centered (horizontally/vertically) in the page.

  • Note about current authentication functionality :

    • Change the logic to use session-based authentication. The portal should be ‘basic http authentication’. Currently it is stateless.

    • All pages that require login MUST redirect user to login page if user is not logged in. i.e. right now you can access any admin page if you are not logged http://localhost:4040/#/admin but the content will be empty.

    • This page should be accessed from /login path http://localhost:4040/#/login

Endowment Landing Page
  • We have a UI Prototype for this page provided in challenge forums.

  • The page has 5 widgets :

    • All charts in all widgets display stats per month in the x-axis. So you need to group stats per month basis then do aggregation/sum of values.

    • The calculation of the top 4 widgets are provided in Excel Sheet (file attached in challenge forums)

      • Total Clean Energy Created (kWh)

        • You have dailyEnergy value in systemperformance, so you will sum a month's dailyEnergy values for each system. These aggregated months will be displayed in the chart.

        • Then aggregate all summed data to display the total clean energy created.

        • SystemPerformance table in ERD that it is missing timestamp, the timestamp is important in time series table to decide when the value was collected, you need it otherwise you cannot tell what dailyEnergy collected in what day.

      • Total Carbon Impact

        • The value of total clean energy created (see above) multiplied by 0.45 kg/kWh.

      • Total Amount Money Invested

        • Group installed Systems on monthly basis on System#InstallationDate field.

        • For each group sum the loan#loanTotal value.

        • The total amount is the sum of all months.

        • Each column in the chart represents a month.

      • Total Money Earned

        • Also as Amount Money Invested you need to group the systems monthly basis and do calculations.

        • For each system : Monthly Money Earned = loan#loanTotal Value * loan#InterestRate / 12

        • The total value is the sum of the values.

      • Total Systems Deployed :

        • This is the number of installed systems the endowment invested in.

        • Use google maps for the map widget.

        • Markers represent installed units.

        • Clicking on a marker should show an information popup about the unit.

  • Existing functionality :

    • The provided application does not have this page implemented. So you are implementing the full functionality of the backend and frontend of this page.

    • This page must be accessed from root path i.e. http://localhost:4040/

    • SystemPerformance model has timestamp field but the database does not have that field.

Admin Landing Page

The page will have navigation in header between 4 sub-pages (by default systems page is displayed):

  • Endowments Page

  • Installers Page

  • Borrowers Page

  • Systems Page

The default page to be displayed is “Systems” page.

Endowments Listing Page

  • This page display table of Endowments

  • User can filter table using Endowment fields

  • Each row in table will have actions :

    • view - take user to Endowment Details page

    • edit

    • delete - user must confirm before processing

  • There will be option to add new endowment.

  • Existing page functionality :

    • The page is missing filtering. You must add it.

    • Add/Edit Endowment panel must be changed to be a windows modal.

    • For Add/Edit Endowment panel, the popup must have option to create user or admin can select existing user.

Endowment Details Page

This page will display the following information :

  • Endowment information

    • User can edit the endowment from this page.

      • The popup (partial) from Endowments listing page MUST be reused here.

    • User delete the endowment from this page.

      • On successful delete it should take user to endowments listing page.

  • Table of borrowers

    • row will display the borrower info

    • there will be option to add new borrower.

    • each row will have actions :

      • edit

      • delete - user must confirm

      • view - take user to Borrower detailed page

    • Inline table filtering must be added.

  • Notes about existing functionality :

    • Page must have navigation page structure as other pages.

    • There should be a back button in the page.

    • Inline filtering must be added.

    • Add/Edit new borrower MUST be changed to be a window modal (popup)

    • The details panel should be better organized, there is a space vertically, the fields should be reuse the space properly vertically instead horizontally.

Installers Listing Page

  • This page display table of Installers from all systems.

    • There MUST two drop down lists above the table to filter the table results :

      • Endowment names drop down list

        • It will filter table to list installers associated with the endowment. The association is through borrower.

        • By default “All” is selected.

      • Borrower names drop down list.

        • This should be hidden if “Endowment” drop down list is “All”.

        • This drop down list will be populated based on “Endowment” drop down list selection. Since a borrower will have exactly one ‘Endowment”, so an “endowment” will have many “borrowers” associated with it.

        • It will filter the installers based on borrower id.

    • The drop down list must show the names not IDs.

  • User can filter table using Installer fields.

  • Each row in table will have actions :

    • edit

    • delete - user must confirm before processing

  • There will be option to add new installer.

  • Notes about existing Functionality :

    • filtering are missing.

    • Add/Edit should be a window modal (popup)

    • Group Address/City/State/ZipCode/Country fields in single column.

    • Company Name and Contract Name columns width should be wider than other columns.

Borrowers Listing Page

  • This page display table of Borrowers.

  • User can filter table using Borrower fields

    • For Endowment, you need to display Endowment.name instead of ID for better UX, but filtering will use the ID of the seleted Endowment.name.

  • Each row in table will have actions :

    • view - take user to Borrower Details page

    • edit

    • delete - user must confirm before processing

  • There will be option to add new Borrower.

  • Notes about existing Functionality:

    • The filtering is missing.

    • The add/edit form must be window modal (popup).

Borrower Details Page

This page will display following information :

  • Selected borrower information

  • Table of loans of selected borrower

    • view - take user to Loan Details page

    • edit

    • delete - user must confirm before processing

  • There will be option to edit borrower details in this page.

  • Add buttons to “add new loan”.

  • Notes about existing Functionality:

    • Page is missing the navigation page structure.

    • Back button is missing.

    • Table of loans header must be fixed. currently it looks as a statement. It should use proper H html tag, and should look as a table caption/title.

    • The details panel should be better organized, there is a space vertically, the fields should be reuse the space properly vertically instead horizontally.

    • Add/Edit loan should be window modal (popup).

Loan Details Page

This page will display the following information :

  • Selected loan information

  • Table of loan payments

    • Filtering will be available by payment date

    • there will be options :

      • edit loan payment

      • delete - user must confirm

    • option to add new loan payment.

  • Notes about existing Functionality:

    • Page is missing the navigation page structure.

    • Back button is missing.

    • Table should have title.

    • Table filtering is missing.

    • The details panel should be better organized, there is a space vertically, the fields should be reuse the space properly vertically instead horizontally.

    • Add/Edit loan payment should be window modal (popup).

Systems Listing Page

  • This page display table of Systems.

  • Table fields to be displayed :

    • Borrower Name

      • This will take user to borrower details page.

    • Installer Name

      • This MUST open a popup with installer information details.

    • Address

    • Installation Date

    • Finish Date

  • User can filter table using System columns.

  • Each row in table will have actions :

    • view - take user to System Details page

    • edit

    • delete - user must confirm before processing

    • foreign fields must be linked to it’s detailed pages.

  • There will be option to add new System

  • There will be option to submit new “System Performance” information by allowing user to upload CSV file.

    • Sample CSV file is provided in challenge forums.

    • This should be a window modal (popup).

    • Progress bar of upload must be added.

  • Notes about existing functionality :

    • Fix the table columns as noted above.

    • Installer Name does not show window modal with details.

    • Missing the filtering

    • Missing option to submit “System Performance”.

    • Add/Edit should be a window modal (popup).

System Details Page

This page will display detailed information of each of following models :

  • Selected System

  • Associated Installer

    • Should be a link, clicking on it will show “installer” details information window modal (must be same partial as in Systems listing page)

  • Associated Borrower

    • A link will take user to Borrower details page.

  • Table of System Performance

    • There will be option to allow user upload CSV file for new system performance.

      • Same popup (partial) in system listing page must be used here.

    • Table will have actions to delete system performance (user must confirm before processing)

  • There should be an option to edit the system.

    • Same popup used in System Listing page must be used here.

  • Notes about existing Functionality :

    • Page must have navigation page structure as other pages.

    • There should be a back button in the page.

    • Inline filtering must be added.

    • Add/Edit MUST be changed to be a window modal (popup)

    • The details panel should be better organized, there is a space vertically, the fields should be reuse the space properly vertically instead horizontally.

    • Fix table to have a clear title (use proper html tag).

Users page

  • This page allow admin to manage users in system :

    • add new user

    • edit existing user

    • update roles  (admin or endowment roles for now)

  • Inline filtering table must be added.

  • Notes about existing Functionality:

    • Add/Edit user must be a popup.

    • Filtering is missing.

General Note

  • All pages with tables must support pagination, pagination can be done at client side.

  • All details pages must have back buttons to listing/parent page.

  • Instead of displaying foreign key in tables, retrieve the ‘name’ field and link it to the foreign key dedicated details page.

  • All pages must be responsive.

    • Existing application pages are not responsive.

  • Provide a readme file for details about deploying the application, configuring it, and testing locally.

  • Notes about existing web application :

    • All code must be documented.

    • You are responsible on fixing any bug on existing web application.

    • You need to provide sufficient test data to verify proper implementation of the charts.

Heroku Hosting

The application will be hosted in heroku. You must test your solution in Heroku and provide required scripts and instructions to deploy there.

Note: existing application does not include deployment instruction to heroku.

Folder Structure

Follow provided web application folder structure.

Documents

Provided in challenge forums:

  • Existing web application.
  • UI Prototype for Endowment Landing page.
  • Sample data and Excel File detailing the calculation of the charts.
finalSubmissionGuidelines:
Deliverables

  • A git patch file of the provided web application.

  • An updated readme.md file detailing all information needed to setup and run the admin web dashboard locally and in heroku. With verification steps.

    • Use github flavored markup text.

  • text file with any notes to reviewer.

  • You don't need to submit a word document for deployment guide.
